org.apache.river.qa.harness

Class MainTestDescription

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.TestDescription
      • org.apache.river.qa.harness.MainTestDescription
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class MainTestDescription
extends TestDescription
    A TestDescription which represents tests that are implemented as source code which is compiled automatically and executed by calling the main method of the compiled class. Tags must be provided in the first comment block of the test source. The supported syntax is quite rigid:
    • The tags must reside in the first comment block in the code
    • The comment block must comprise the first non-blank text in the code
    • The comment block must begin with the '\/\*' sequence and any tags on this initial line will be ignored
    • The tag '@test' must be the first tag in the comment block
    • Tags may be of the form:
      @key key value is implicitly true
      @key value1 value2 ... values are separated by white space and may not contain white space
      @key=value value may contain any character, including '='. White space in value is retained
    • The @library and @build tags may occur multiple times. The tag values are appended in the order read
    • If the run tag is encountered, the run options are processed. There is no action implied by the run tag. The test class returned by getTestClassName is always run as the test, regardless of the existance or content of the run tag.
    • The comment block must be terminated with the '\*\/' sequence
    The following tags are defined:
    @test A mandatory tag which identifies this as a valid test description
    @library identifies libraries of source files which may be accessed by the test. The library directory must be specified relative to the location of the test source file containing the @library tag. Multiple entries per line, and multiple occurances of the @library tag, are allowed.
    @build identifies the names of source files to compile (the .java extension is omitted. All library files to be compiled must be named in @build tags. It is legal, but unnecessary, to include the name of the test source file to compile. However, if other source files in the test directory must also be compiled, those names should also be specified in the build tag. Multiple entries per line, and multiple occurances of the @build tag, are allowed.
    @run main/policy=policyfile vmarg1 vmarg2 ... This tag defines the execution environment of the test. The main token defines this as a main-style test, and may be omitted. If /policy= is defined, the named policy file is resolved relative to the test source directory. Any remaining tokens which begin with a '-' character are included in the VM options when the test VM is invoked.
    Any other tags are interpreted as configuration value definitions.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainTestDescription

        public MainTestDescription(String name,
                           Properties p,
                           QAConfig config)
                    throws TestException
        Construct a test description for a test with the given name. The name is assumed to represent the name of a source file relative to the installation directory of the test harness. The internal properties object is populated by parsing a set of tags provided at the beginning of the test source file.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the test
        config - the config object for this test
        Throws:
        TestException - if mandatory tags are missing or well-known tags are malformed

                       throws TestException
        Overridden method which causes the constructor to initialize the internal properties object from tags in the source file.
        Throws:
        TestException - if mandatory tags are missing or well-known tags are malformed

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Indicates whether some other object is equal to this one. obj is considered equal to this object if it is an instance of TestDescription and has a name which is identical to this name.
        Overrides:
        equals in class TestDescription
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to test for equality
        Returns:

      • getClasspath

        public String getClasspath()
        Returns the classpath for compilation and test execution. The classpath consists of the JAR file containing MainWrapper followed by the directory containing the test classes, followed by the directory containing the test sources.
        Returns:
        the classpath string

      • getJVMArgs

        public String[] getJVMArgs()
        Augments the arguments returned by the superclass call with property definition strings for the properties:
        • test.src
        • test.classes
        Returns:
        the array of property definitions

      • getPolicyFile

        public String getPolicyFile()
        Get the policy file for the test VM. If the policy is not specified by the configuration, then null is returned to indicate no policy is to be used
        Returns:
        the policy file to use, or null

      • getCategories

        public String[] getCategories()
        Returns a default category name if no categories have been defined for the test. This is special behavior for main tests to retain compatibility with jtreg tagged source files.
        Overrides:
        getCategories in class TestDescription
        Returns:
        a single category, default, if no categories are defined for the test

      • getCommandLine

        public String[] getCommandLine()
                        throws TestException
        Get the command line for the test VM. Before the command line is constructed, any required test directories are created and source files are compiled.
        Throws:
        TestException - if a failure occurs setting up the test environment or compiling the sources.

      • getCodebase

        public String getCodebase()
        Returns the codebase for the test. The codebase may be tagged by the parameter name testCodebase. If this value is not defined, null is returned (inhibiting any codebase annotation). Tests run by MainWrapper will typically not set a codebase annotation.
        Returns:
        the codebase for the test

      • getWrapperClassName

        public String getWrapperClassName()
        Return the wrapper class name for executing a test in another VM. The value returned is that obtained by searching the configuration for the key testWrapper. If this key is not found, the default value org.apache.river.qa.harness.MainWrapper is returned. One special value is recognized:
        mainwrapper if the search for testWrapper returns this value (case insensitive), then this method will return org.apache.river.qa.harness.MainWrapper
        If the search for testWrapper returns any other value, then that value is returned by this method. Note that this test descriptor performs command-line setup specific to MainWrapper; it is unlikely that specifying a different wrapper would result in correct behavior.
        Returns:
        the class name of the test wrapper

      • getTestArgs

        public String[] getTestArgs()
        Get the test arguments. This method returns a test argument list formated for MainWrapper, which requires the name of the test, the name of the test class, and the set of test arguments retrieved from the configuration bound to the key testArgs.
        Returns:
        the complete VM argument list, which is never null

      • getWorkingDir

        public File getWorkingDir()
        Return the working directory for test execution. For MainWrapper tests, the working directory is the scratch directory. If the scratch directory has not been created, an IllegalStateException is thrown.
        Returns:
        the scratch directory
